reviews.text: Minuses: Shower pressure and time get hot water not good. Stopped at front desk for wake up calls - first morning no call, second morning two hours early. Used the automatic wake up on the last night and worked fine.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: Plus: Nice renovations, staff is great and one of the best work out rooms anywhere with great Precor equipment

reviews.text: As a Diamond Member I can not discribe the treatment I receieved from Mohamed E at the front desk has been outstanding.I have stayed in hotels for my job many times but a Staff here at RyeBrook espacially Muhamed E. were amazing. I stayed here for over 3 months I can tell it was the best hotel I have ever been in to.Staff there treats you like a 'King' Would definitely stay here again when in NY.
reviews.title: Premium Service

reviews.text: Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton Westchester/Hilton Rye Town whatever you want to call it. The service was tremendous! The hotel is currently undergoing renovations so you have to use a different entrance for the lobby. No big deal except it makes for a further walk from the parking lot if you have to park there. Parking is free, though which is great.
reviews.title: Great location,motel needing major facelift.

reviews.text: Price is right, hotel's convenient, staff is friendly. Check in process was smooth and efficient. Room was comfortable with nice view of the woods. Setting of the hotel is bucolic. Bar Staff extremely engaging, maybe because it's NY, but they'll talk to you about anything. Close to major thorough fares, so easy in and out in the morning.
reviews.title: Rye Town Hilton

reviews.text: Check in people messed up my room and reassigned me to a room that stunk like BO. They were also doing construction at am on Sunday morning so all I heard was banging and drilling. This hotel is BELOW average for a Hilton and unless you have to stay here I would not recommend it.
reviews.title: Poor Hotel Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I often go to the Hilton in Rye Brook for an overnight during the summer. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the grounds are lovely, and the pool area is as pretty and comfortable as at most resorts. We enjoy the buffet on Sunday and there are lots of good restaurants in the area. We really appreciate that it is perhaps 45 minutes from the city. Even when the hotel is filled with guests- usually there for weddings- the staff is attentive and accommodating. One suggestion we have for the hotel is that it would be nice for there to be food service at the pool- we have to go into the dining area and wait for sandwiches etc. to be prepared.
reviews.title: Good place for weekend away from NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at multiple Hilton's throughout the years. This hotel should not be called a Hilton as far as rooms are concerned. There is absolutely nothing offered here. At the minimum, you get a cookie and bottled water at a Double Tree (part of the Hilton Hotel family). At this place, they do not offer anything. You get just a room. Let's talk about the check-in experience. It was quite sad. I am Hilton Honors' member. I came and stood in the Hilton Honors' line. There were people ahead of me that were being helped. The front desk manager and the single employee were chatting. I stood there for a couple of minutes. Finally, I walked up to them to check-in. It seemed like I was "intruding" on their conversation for them to help me. I am not sure what hospitality training they have had, but it was surely lacking at that moment. There were a lot of other things that made my experience unpleasant (i.e., construction in the room next to me at 6pm). Overall, this hotel should not be called a Hilton but rather something else.
reviews.title: Should not be a Hilton

reviews.text: Extremely disappointing for a Hilton property. Needed a hotel close to the Westchester County Airport for one evening and chose this property to gain Hilton points. We are Hilton Diamond members and have stayed at many properties within the Hilton family and around the U.S. and in Europe and have never seen such a dirty hotel. Room was dirty, including the sheets, and AC gave off horrendous smell! Rugs in hallway were musty and stained. There was a convention going on - and people running and playing soccer in hallways, picnicking on front lawn when we checked in, and leaving cups and garbage around hallways. There were loud noises throughout the entire evening - including loud pounding on our doors for no reason. There were mice running in our hallway - looked like they came out of a room down the hall. Thank goodness we saw this at 5:00 in the morning as we were checking out. Definitely beware before booking this property. We booked this based on description which indicated hotel had been "renovated". Not sure what, if anything, was renovated! Hilton has some work to do with this property.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here

reviews.text: Being a Hilton property, and paying the prices I did, I expected a little more out of this hotel. The rooms were not quite up to the level of most Hiltons I have stayed at. They were large enough and clean, but not the expected luxury that some Hiltons provide. Check in was a complete nightmare. There were probably around 40 people checking in the same time I was, and they only had 2 people at the front desk. Took around 30 min or so. The pool at this place was very strange. It was indoors and right next to the lobby, and completly packed with kids. Not inviting in the slightest bit.
reviews.title: Decent, but nothing special for a Hilton

reviews.text: Its not that this place is awful or anything, it just doesnt quite live up to its name or price. The competition is this area is really not very high, RYe and eastern WestChester county NY have suprisingly few hotels to choose from. Thats probably why this place seems to not go the extra mile, and looks as if it needs renovations. All in All you will probably be fine staying here, just dont expect too much out of it.
reviews.title: enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at the Hilton Rye Town recently while attending a nearby family wedding. The reception staff was pleasant & helpful. Our room 335 was spacious, clean, comfortably furnished with a pleasant view of tall trees on their 45 acre parklike site. We received a daily newspaper at our door and the bill was slipped under our door prior to our departure.
reviews.title: I do not recommend this hotel!!!!

reviews.title: Worst Hotel in the Area
reviews.text: This time, the indoor pool seemed murky and out of commission, making families with children who booked in for the weekend a little put out. It didn't help that we arrived in pouring rain -- the hotel parks cars right in the driveway, which made it possible for only one car at a time to be unloaded under the portico -- the most chaotic check-in I've ever had anywhere, given the backup of cars, parents trying to pick up kids, and a wedding party arriving. It happens, but the operations of the drive-up need to be re-examined.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This past weekend, I took a trip with my family to the Hilton in Rye Brook/ Westchester (We are Hilton Blue level members). It was a nice getaway from our New York City life, and a very short drive, as well. The hotel has a welcoming lobby area, and a nice restaurant and bar too. The outdoor grounds are beautiful. We enjoyed pleasant walks on the paved pathways, admiring the trees and flowers, the white gazebo, and the green luscious grass. Both the indoor and the outdoor swimming pools were so refreshing! We had fun at the indoor pool on Saturday night, and swam outdoors under the hot sun on Sunday. It was so glorious and relaxing! (Although the water was a tad bit too COLD, brrr...) The exercise room was also well-equipped... my husband took a 5 mile jog on one of the treadmills. There were a few weddings at the hotel over the weekend, and it was pretty to watch. Our room, though, was surprisingly not what we hoped for. We arrived, and were greeted by a terrible stench. At first we thought it was coming from the garbage can in the bathroom, so we put that out the door. However, the smell didn't go away with it. Every time we entered our room, there was this horrible whiff that hit our nostrils. Because of this, we tried spending most of our awake time out of the room. On two separate occasions, we complained about the smell. We were hoping that someone would come up and investigate to see what was causing the smell and how it could be rectified, but they didn't even take the time to send an employee up to help us. They did offer us a late check-out, so we got to stay in our smelly room for an extra hour. Nice! ;) (If you visit this wonderful establishment, try not to stay in room 3012) Hope I was of help!! :)
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway
Nice and comfy
reviews.text: Good overall service, staff could be friendlier, over all clean and well maintained. The rooms are large, and the views are better than most. Some decent restaurants in the village of Mamaroneck nearby. Quaint little village, by the harbor

This was homebase for my brothers wedding in Greenwich CT and it was OK. We are from the area and thought it would be best to stay as close to the wedding venue as possible, and with other out of town guests and this really was our only option for such a large group. For that purpose it was fine but I would never stay here for pleasure. I understand it is going through renovations but there were lots of little things that could have been better maintained in the process. Jessica at the front desk was amazing, cannot stress that enough. As a hotel owner, I would LOVE to have someone like her on my staff. And the head bar tender as well, excellent service. His sidekick, awful. A small group of us at the bar ordered drinks three times in the period of half an hour and rather than fill ours, he would serve other guests first..then come back and ask us again what we ordered. Upon signing the "chit", he asked where his tip was. Called room service to ask if they had pizza and were rudely told that "this aint no [--] Dominoes". Housekeeping was amazing as was Nico in the gift shop. Breakfast buffet closed 15 minutes early on a Sunday morning...(there were five other wedding groups at the hotel so you know many arrived at the very last minute in the hopes of coffee or food) but it did have plenty to chose from which was a surprise. Coffee to go instead of breakfast...be prepared to pay. They should just let each guest have one if they cannot eat in and it was a huge surprise that they did not have coffee 24/7 in the lobby. Rugs, stained. Wall paper, peeling off walls. Ice machines....only one was working in the entire hotel....luckily the head bar tender filled up our coolers. We had a deluxe king at a rate of $220 per night with breakfast which for the area is very good...but the hotel just had a dingy and outdated feel. Bedding excellent...rugs filthy and stained.
reviews.title: Practical for sleep, not a destination hotel.

reviews.text: I am a hilton diamond member and stay at this hotel 20+ times a year. Great location and friendly staff. The bartenders in the lobby bar are a little clueless, but other than that since this hotel did the refurbishment of the entrance it is great.
reviews.title: Quality stay

reviews.text: Everything was great! Clean, large rooms. Beds are usual Hilton beds, very comfortable. Pleasant staff, good food. Will surely stay here again. Cannot say a single bad thing. Location was just off the Interstate, very easy to get to.

I asked, as usual, for a quiet room, and was put in a wing of the hotel that is obviously reserved for people like me. This was a wise move, as this hotel does a big wedding/party business and there were quite a few celebrating people walking around (including many children).

reviews.text: The room was standard Hilton - large, clean, and well-furnished. The bed was a little soft, but the bedding smelled very fresh, and the bathroom was also clean with fresh-smelling towels. Wifi is free with Hilton Honors and is very fast.

reviews.text: The rug smelled & was visibly worn. There was mold between the tiles on the bathroom walls. The furniture was chipped & scratched -- a lot. Even the plastic bag in the ice bucket had been previously used! There was one valet parker at the front of the hotel on a holiday weekend when the hotel was hosting a convention. He did not seem to speak much English. The front desk staff was slow & indifferent. They frequently did not answer the phone. The hotel was noisy until late into the night b/c of the conventioneers. The room service staff was rude. I could not over-ride an automatic 18+% "gratuity" on the room service bill. That is not a gratuity, that is a charge. One that exceeds the average tip for *table service.* I was promised a call from the bookkeeping department about correcting this by documenting the receipt & amount I actually signed for. I never received such a call. The manager was patronizing. He promised me an adjustment in the rate of my stay which ---surprise!--- never showed up on my final charge. In short, not a single department in this hotel was welcoming or efficient. Very poor value, indifferent to contemptuous service, worn facility. Better options close by.

reviews.title: Disappointing for a Hilton Hotel-I regret not reading the trip advisor before choosing this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was not clean. As soon as we walked in we could see how dirty the floors were. Jackie at the front desk was the only good thing about the hotel. The room which was in a renovated part had scratched furniture, dirty floors, and a terrible musty smell that came out when the a/c was on. Simply maintenance fixes too, one light was not working, and the faucet was missing a piece of it. If the a/c was low it was not too bad. We asked to be moved but by the time we heard back we were already in bed. Jackie was very helpful with trying to get us a room but with 2 weddings the same night it was not possible. They do have an indoor and outdoor pool. Something was up with the water from the indoor pool and it made my skin itch. The grounds outside are nice. The renovated part is also in the back of the hotel which is a quiet area. The one good thing about the hotel was the breakfast. The buffet had fresh fruit and a wonderful selection. It is close to the city which is what we wanted without having to stay in the city. We have stayed at many Hiltons, the Inn, the Garden, the Hotel, the Double Tree, but it seems that anytime we go to NY the quality is just poor. It is a simply maintenance issues that should be fixed before anyone enters a room. Cleanliness is a must for any hotel. I booked this hotel based on the fact that we like to earn points and for the most part Hilton is a good choice. I would skip this one till they make some changes.
reviews.title: Rye Town Hilton...great experience

reviews.text: We stay at this Hilton every year for our family reunion...we were pleasantly surprised on this trip...the lobby bar was totally renovated...the staff is accommodating and competent...the bed in the room was so comfortable we didn't want to leave. Bravo Hilton!
reviews.title: Well appointed rooms and grounds with good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was filled to capacity with two wedding parties and a fraternal convention but was entirely overwhelmed and completely unapologetic about it. We arrived on a Friday evening and there was no parking valet in sight. After we checked in and self-parked our car, the valet finally appeared and assisted us with our bags. Prior to checkout on Sunday around 1 PM, we called guest services to request a bellman and were told there was a 30-minute wait. Needless to say, we were not about to subordinate our schedule to the hotel's convenience and made due on our own. There were only two employees at reception and we waited nearly 15 minutes before we were able to check out. (There was only one person ahead of us in line). We had requested a late checkout and were initially offered an extra half hour (which we finally negotiated to 90 minutes). Since the reception clerk informed us that they had already had a few hundred checkouts that morning, we found it interesting that it was so difficult to obtain a later checkout time. The parking lot was nearly empty and I'm quite sure the hotel was not going to be full that Sunday night. The room was reasonably attractive and a good size but needed some updating and repair. It is also surprising (and disappointing) that a resort-type hotel does not have safes in the rooms. It is extremely inconvenient to have to visit the front desk to store valuables when using the pool. The hotel has beautiful grounds and could be a luxurious facility but an additional investment by the owners would be required. I attended a wedding here about 35 years ago when it was simply gorgeous. Those days seem to be long gone.
reviews.title: Seriously Understaffed

reviews.text: love this place. they have indoro and outdoor pools that are very well maintained, excellent service, the grounds are gorgeous. pricing is more than affordable. my kids have a blast. they literally want us to sell our house and move into the hilton westchester! this place is just the perfect getaway! cant wait to go back there again as you cant beat a weekend at this place.

reviews.text: This Hilton is located in a scenic woodsy area of northern Westchester County, NY. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. Once you got through the lobby, it became apparent that this is a rather dated property. The hallways were dark, carpets were stained, and there were some strange odors. The rooms were acceptable, but nothing out of the ordinary. WiFi was available, but for a fee. Free WiFi is always a welcome amenity and sadly missing from this property. There was no continental or other breakfast included in the room charge. Also, you should be aware, there is no where within walking distance of the property to obtain food. The housekeeping staff was friendly and very efficient.
reviews.title: OK Hotel for a short stay

reviews.text: I don't know what drugs the people are who rated this hotel as being good or acceptable. All I can say is that this place is without a doubt one of the worst hotels in which I have ever stayed. After trying two different rooms we finally had to settle. However, each room reeked of a mold type of an odor. The carpets were stained and fiflthy and the beds were horrible. Telephone didn't work in one room and television, when it worked, had a poor picture. We also had the displeasure of experiencing the Sunday brunch. If you want to gag - try the srambled eggs. They were hatched from another planet. The rest of the "food" was pretty much of the same disgusting stuff. Nothing like stale breads and God awful omlets to get your day going. Oh, and if you arrive on rainy day you can get to experience the numerous leaks throughout the lobby area. You want to stay here? Good luck!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here on a Saturday night and it was like Grand Central Station! When we arrived at check in time there was a long line waiting. The people at the desk were very efficient however and we ended up waiting maybe only 10 minutes or so. The place is huge and we had to walk down several long corridors and take two different elevators to get to our room. Except for many dark stains on the carpet (hate that!) the room was nice. The beds were comfortable and the room and bath were clean. We did have a problem with the plumbing however but not until right before we checked out. We were staying here for a nearby wedding along with many others, some people seemed to have nicer rooms than others. One friend had a very musty/smelly room. Sunday morning I was woken up by staff setting up tables and chairs for an even right outside my room...one even waved to me when I opened the curtain to see what was going on.

reviews.text: This hotel appears well designed for corporate conferences and group functions like weddings. Parts are being renovated now but I was never bothered by noise or dust during my stay. The lobby does not appear to have been updated recently and has an odd "country" motif. The staff was very helpful and pleasant and I enjoyed a nice buffet breakfast. My room had already been renovated recently and was very clean, and quiet with a great view of the surrounding woods. The bed was new and very comfortable. I don't believe any of the guest rooms have wifi yet but there is wired hi speed internet available. The grounds are large and beautiful but there's nothing within walking distance of the hotel. The layout of the hotel is quite confusing. Get detailed directions from the staff before you venture to find your room. It may be a very long walk so plan to wear comfortable shoes.

Hotel is only busy because of proximity to major companies and Hilton loyalty (points). Staff is friendly, but it can't make up for the mold.

aka: Hilton Westchester - Rye Brook Hotel Rye Brook
description: The Hilton Westchester hotel, located in Westchester County a New York City suburb of Rye, NY and is minutes east of White Plains, NY and 8 miles from Westchester County-White Plains Airport(HPN) and Greenwich CT. The Hilton Westchester hotel is the ideal location for White Plains shopping and going to the Westchester Mall. The hotel is situated on 45 beautifully landscaped acres of lush woodlands, combining the relaxed setting of a resort with the flexibility of a full-service business hotel. Guest has easy access to New York with the Metro North or Amtrak and can be in NYC within 45 mins. So if you are visiting Westchester County or White Plains for business or pleasure we look forward to welcoming you to the Hilton Westchester hotel.
